feed.title: Combined summary - Bitcoin Core 0.12.1 release candidate 1 available

entry.title: Combined summary - Bitcoin Core 0.12.1 release candidate 1 available
entry.summary: Wladimir J. van der Laan has released a new version of Bitcoin Core with an update to rc2, following the previous release candidate (rc1) being deemed "DOA" according to meeting minutes from Thursday. The binaries for this updated version are available at https://bitcoin.org/bin/bitcoin-core-0.12.1/test.rc2/, and the source code can be found on Github at https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/tree/v0.12.1rc2. This new release candidate includes the BIP9, BIP68, and BIP112 softfork, as well as various bugfixes and updated translations. Preliminary release notes for the release are available at https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/0.12/doc/release-notes.md.Release candidates serve as test versions for releases, and if no critical problems are discovered, this release candidate will become the official 0.12.1 release. Bugs should be reported using the issue tracker at Github: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues. The previous release candidate, rc1, is also still available and was released with the same features as the current version, but bugs have since been fixed in the updated release candidate.
